DOC.brief_summary: The aim of this prospective, randomized , blinded study is to compare two different infusion techniques (continuous VS intermittent automatic bolus) to assess the effects of postoperative analgesia after Day-Case anterior cruciate ligament (ACL) reconstruction.
DOC.brief_title: Adductor Canal Block: Continuous Infusion Versus Automatic Intermittent Bolus
DOC.criteria: Age above 18 years old American society of anesthesiology (ASA) physical status III Signed informed consensus ASA >II Unstable neurological disease Diabetic mellitus (DM) type III Allergy to used drugs Opioid chronic treatment Consensus refusal or not valid Anticoagulant therapy Postoperative intensive care required
